did.abstract: Correspondence reflecting social and economic conditions and referring specifically to the purchase of farmland, weaving and spinning, the birth and growth of the children, and other personal and family matters. An 1825 letter from Thomas Johnson to Isaac Hall (Eleanor's son) contains medical field advancements from the University of Pennsylvania lectures of Dr. Nathaniel Chapman and Dr. Samuel Jackson.

bioghist.p: Resident of Staunton (Augusta Co.), Va; wife of John A. Douglas of Loudon Co.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: Correspondence reflecting social and economic conditions and referring specifically to the purchase of farmland, weaving and spinning, the birth and growth of the children, and other personal and family matters. An 1825 letter from Thomas Johnson to Isaac Hall (Eleanor's son) contains medical field advancements from the University of Pennsylvania lectures of Dr. Nathaniel Chapman and Dr. Samuel Jackson.
